meanings.definition: relating to or affected with atresia
meanings.sent1: The atretic valve in his heart caused him to feel tired all the time.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the atretic condition of the artery was causing the blockage.
meanings.sent3: The atretic door refused to open, making it a stubborn piece of furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her atretic sense of direction led her to the wrong side of town.
meanings.sent5: The atretic flower struggled to bloom, but eventually, it blossomed beautifully.

meanings.definition: a congenital absence or closure of a normal body opening
meanings.sent1: The baby's atretic condition meant he needed surgery to correct the issue.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with an atretic in her ear canal, which affected her hearing.
meanings.sent3: The atretic window in the house made it impossible to get fresh air inside.
meanings.sent4: His atretic view of the world limited his perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The atretic tunnel was closed off, preventing any passage through it.
